description:
"Rising Sun: The First Sino-Japanese War, 1894-1895" is a historical board wargame that deals with the entire First Sino-Japanese War, which was the first foreign war for modern Japan. Players take charge of Japan or the Qing Dynasty and fight for control of the Korean Peninsula, Liaodong Peninsula, Shandong Peninsula, and Penghu Islands. Alternatively, the Japanese Army can challenge the Zhili decisive battle.

As with historical facts, the Navy has a big role to play in games. At that time, the infrastructure was not well-developed, and it was the transport vessels that could most efficiently carry large numbers of troops and supplies, and command of the sea was needed to secure maritime transport. How will the Combined Fleet challenge the Beiyang Fleet, which has the battleships Dingyuan and Zhenyuan, which were called the strongest ships in the Orient? And how will the Japanese Army capture the fortress of Lushun and Weihaiwei?

The game system of this game is called card-driven, and makes full use of cards that represent war resources and historical events and tactics. But more important than how to use the card is a "strategy" that looks at how to end the war.

A set of miniature wargames rules published in Wargames Illustrated 31 for refighting battles from the 'Anarchy' civil war period of English history, where forces loyal to the King and Empress fought each other for control of England.

If you too have eaten Casu marzu, if you always carry the Island in your heart, you have chosen the perfect game.
Spuntino is quick and easy, perfect for an evening with friends or family, ideal for adults and children who love good regional cuisine.

With Spuntino's illustrated cards, you can indulge yourself in inventing new culinary combinations and combine a thousand flavors to get more points than your opponents.
Are you ready for an explosion of Sardinian tastes?
Each game lasts about 30 minutes, just like a real snack, and then you'll be ready for a new game where you can enjoy new delightful flavors.
You will have 110 illustrated playing cards at your disposal to create the most combinations and declare a snack. You can also create delicious combinations with wine and "filu'e ferru" and become the sommelier of the family.

The aim of this board game is to get the highest number of points by making combinations of typical Sardinian dishes. To win, you will have to become the Snack King by getting more points than your opponents.

In From the Moon, players are representatives of factions trying to complete missions departing from our Moon in order to help humankind survive elsewhere in the galaxy. Indeed, the fate of the Earth is sealed, and time is running out!

The plan is to launch three survival missions before all life on Earth ends. To do that, each faction will contribute by building parts of the ships and build their own lunar base to store the necessary resources.

In the end, which faction will be most suited to lead the future of our race out there, far away in space?

—description from the publisher (translated).

Are you ready to lift the secret of the library?

With horror you discover that you're trapped inside the dark Monestary library. Your only chance to escape are 30 riddles you discover hidden in a Bible...

A bible themed escape game for home..

Schalten - Aber Schlau: Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel is a trivia game about energy usage put out by a German energy supplier to help folks learn about their energy efficiency.

—user summary

The game is inspired by Bruno Morchio's novels starring Bacci Pagano, an ironic and disillusioned Genoese private investigator.

You will have to work together to help the famous Genoese private investigator Bacci Pagano to solve five cases. Five unpublished stories set between Genoa and Sardinia, a map of the city and a newspaper page full of clues: this is the material contained in the box that, together with a good dose of investigative intuition and a spirit of adventure, will guide you in the investigation.

The game contains five stories:


     Book thieves
     The suspect ship
     Transfer to Ogliastra
     In the age of Coronavirus
     Invisible lives

Welcome to Doomtown, where you try to gain control of a western town set in the Weird West of Deadlands.  In this world, cowpokes good and bad wield guns, steampunk gadgets, and spells of all sorts, and death is sometimes just a minor inconvenience.

In Deadwood, South Dakota, Eagle woman That All Look At tries to enforce a fragile treaty.   Hao-Te Zui's Anarchists fight for the townsfolk that E.B Farnum's consortium of Entrepreneurs are trying to drive out of business.  Bass Reeves, the West's most persistent Marshal, arrives in pursuit of the notorious outlaw, Jessica Patchett, who's trying to escape her bloody past.   And out in the Badlands, Ursula's cult prepares to summon the power of the great Worm.

Doomtown: Weird West Edition is a poker-driven, territory control card game, updated from (and fully compatible with) the 2014 release of Doomtown: Reloaded, which was based on the 1998 Origins Awards Best Trading Card Game, Deadlands: Doomtown by Alderac Entertainment Group!

All aspects of the game that require randomization are controlled via a poker mechanism as every card has a suit and value. Preparing for the hands you want to draw is as much a part of deck building as choosing the actions and dudes you'll want to play. Your deck is built around an Outfit, one of the six main groups attempting to control Deadwood.

Combat is resolved via poker hands.  Deciding who goes first  is decided by drawing the top five cards from your deck and the lowest poker hands go first.

Players take one action each, in turn which can include:

     Hiring a new dude (getting you influence in town)
     Purchasing a new deed (getting you control in town)
     Shopping for gear for your dudes
     Start a shootout with your opponents to try to remove their influence.


When each player passes, you reach "Sundown" for the day.  If any player has more control in town than anyone else has influence, you win.

-description from publisher

ä¸€çž¬ã®åç”»ã€ã‚ã‚‹ã„ã¯ç„¡æ„è­˜ã®ç›®è¦šã‚ (A momentary masterpiece or an unconscious awakening) is a drawing and deduction game from Japan. Players take on the roles of artists and critics, and create artworks to be assessed by the other players.

The game has a deck of cards with themes and other with interpretations. A player creates a drawing and displays it in a picture frame. The other players critique the work according to the choices on the cards (ABC, 123) and vote with markers on the rondel. Does the artwork represent A1 or C2 and so on. Then the artist reveals the intent they had written down.

Players then advance their meeples on the rondel depending on how well they did compared to the expectation.

The game be played with young children by using simple themes and motifs. The intent is to create a happy interaction between artists.
user summary

Players build a deck of cards and duel against their opponent's deck. Players are champions attempting to reduce their opponent's life total to zero. The first player to reduce the opponent's champion to zero or otherwise destroy the opponent's champion card is the winner..

First off, the game has a deck construction element to it, which is done before to the actual game by choosing what cards are included in a deck. This must include 1 champion card, no more, no less and 50 other cards of the players choice, although a player cannot have more than 3 copies of any card.

The game has four major factions, all of which use champion, cast and reaction cards, besides that each faction has their own special types of cards they can use: 
The Meritus uses equipment cards (such as swords and shields) and equipping these cards allows their champion to use them as an extension of his/herself.
The Sortis has enchantments which have over time effects and they also have spell cast cards.
The Divitiae have construct and upgrade cards so they can build machines and improve them.
Diogeni have creature, plant and force of nature cards to gain bonus resources and grow stronger over the course of the game.

Players gain resources and draw cards from their deck to determine what they can play each turn. Many cards have bonus conditions or options which allow for advanced strategies. There is a good list of game mechanics, including a mechanic called "the conflict" which lets players respond to each others action and allows more skilled players the opportunity to pull ahead while remaining easy enough for new players to learn.

Though the game is intended for a two-player duel, there is room to allow more players to play.

—description from the designer

ä¸–ç•Œæè— (The World's Fear of Locusts) is a co-operative game from Japan for three players only. Players are working to stop locust swarms across the world by researching grasshoppers, and by attack swarms of locusts spreading on the wind.

Each player takes on a role in the game, entomologist (Studying insects), a control expect, and a supply expert. The players win by completing their research and eliminating the locust swarms. Even under harsh conditions, players can work out a successful solution.

The game board shows various sections of land, and a spinner decides the wind direction, controlling how the locusts spread. The game includes 3D grasshoppers and locusts.
user summary

A 2 player Jass with a traditional deck. Each player plays against the other player and also a single shared “dummy” who is considered a player in its own right but whose cards are played by both. The goal is to capture tricks so that one’s total captured card-points are either the highest or the lowest of the two humans and dummy--that is, avoiding being in the middle.  After each hand the top and bottom slots earn sticks (positive game points) while the middle slot earns potatoes (negative game pts). As both players compete against each other over eight hands to earn the most sticks, the Winner must also ensure the Dummy doesn’t beat them both--because if it wins, both humans lose, equally. A perverse game of positioning!

Part of the Twisted Dummy series of two player games in the European tradition.

—description from the publisher

HotRod is a game of collecting fast cars and modifying them to race on different terrains. Players use dice to create tracks, collect HotRods or modify them. Every 5th turn, players will complete a scoring round for one of the Bonus cards. Players may want to delay a bonus card, but doing so will only offer them half of their points.

Specializing in certain Terrains or Track types can help players win big when they race each of their collected HotRods at the end of the game.

Uses language independent components!

HotRod is playable by 1-100 players (or more) in 30-60 minutes. HotRod is part of Roll and Write Revolution! Digital release initially, digital and physical copies will be available from the Game Crafter after the campaign ends.

The game starts with players designing the Town by choosing from the 12 available districts, ranging from forest to the central business district. Changing the set up of the Town means that the game has more variability over time as districts advantage different candidates. Players are also assigned purple 'values' cards, which they share with the players next to them. This means you have things in common but, in a 4 player game, have nothing in common with the person sitting across from you! Values are important: your candidates perform better if they have the same values and your projects give you more legacy points if they also align with your values.

Once the Town is established and the districts chosen, players select cards (their candidates and inventory) and begin building up their arsenal for the upcoming elections. Be sure to select good candidates! They come with one or more Persuasive (P), Strategic (S) or Ruthless (R) skills which determines the number and type of actions they can make as candidates and later on as councillors.

Each district is up for election and players spend resources trying to ensure their candidate comes out as the winner. Players adopt the persona of their candidate and give a short 'campaign speech' to the table, outlining why they deserve your vote. The player with the "best speech" wins additional support which increases their odds of being elected. Support is also increased by the candidate's popularity in that district and any other cards you burn to give you a competitive edge. Be careful: the more you burn now, the less you can do once you're in Town Hall! Each candidate elected is worth legacy points, which decide the game.

Winning candidates become councillors who can complete project in their term of office if they have the necessary skills (P, S or R). Complete a project and get more legacy points. Diversity is key: players are rewarded bonus points for a complete PSR set of 3. At the end of 3 rounds the player with the highest number of legacy points is the winner! For experienced players, there is the option to include an add-on mode where the Mayor of the day tries to persuade players to support their proposal.

-description from publisher

A pop culture trivia game that takes players on a nostalgic road trip through the memories from the Baby Boom era: from poodle skirts to mini skirts; The Twist to Disco; I Love Lucy to SNL; and hopscotch to protest marches.

How to Play Boom Again
  Divide the players into two teams.
  Put one token on each center section of the game board.
  Pick a category – any category.
  Someone from the other team will read you a question.
  If you get it right, “tug” the token for that category one step closer to your team’s side of the board.
  If the other team chooses the same category, they can “tug” that same token back one space toward their side.
  Play tug-of-war trying to pull tokens off the board.
  The first team to collect three tokens WINS!

Game Contents
  Two card boxes filled with 2,244 questions
  6 Boomer tokens:
    Metal Skate Key
    “Students For Kennedy” Button
    45-RPM Record Insert
    Vietnam Era Dog Tag
    Roach Clip
    Milk Bottle Cap

In football, champions make the difference!
The club has decided that this will be the turning point, new faces are needed on the pitch and on the bench! The President has left you a nice budget and carte blanche to buy the strongest players, with the certainty that you will do everything to win the Championship (and why not, even the coveted Cup of the Gods).
Turn Over is a solitaire dice and cards game, with a two player variant. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the players cards you play to try to score more goals and concede fewer. 
Try to make a career in this managerial soccer game.

—description from the designer

The players, each of whom is assigned a color, receive 3 chips at the start of the game and must answer questions during the course of the game. To do this, the active player moves a figure across color fields by rolling the dice. The player whose color was hit must answer the question correctly or he loses a chip. The player who has no more chips is eliminated. If you can answer a question correctly and you have less than 3 chips, you get one chip back. The last player left wins the game.

—user summary

Memory Game.  The equipment consists of: a circular wooden board with an outer ring of 16 holes, and an inner ring of 8 holes; 24 wooden pegs, with their root painted in one of six colours; a six-sided die with each face showing one of the same six colours.
The pegs are randomly placed in the holes in the board, so that the coloured tips are invisiible, and the board randomly rotated to negate any memory of their placement.
The starting player rolls the die, and then draws a peg.  If its colour matches that shown on the die, the peg is retained, the player scores a point, and has another turn (roll, draw). This continues until the peg colour does not match the die roll, in which case the peg is replaced in the same position on the board, and play passes to the next player.  Once all pegs have been drawn from the board and matched, the player with the most points is the winner.

It's summer, and you're riding the sun-drenched half-pipes of Pelican Park. Locals know there's no ledge too high, no rail too long, and no ramp too dangerous for you and your crew. Nail rad trick combos and show off your skills, but be careful — the longer you stay on your board, the more likely you are to bail!

The object of Skate Summer is to score the most points by doing trick combos, collecting goal tokens, and visiting S-K-A-T-E-R locations. The game is played in rounds. Each round has the following phases:

1. COMBOS: Players simultaneously play trick cards, earn rewards, and roll dice to check their balance.
2. SKILLS & POINTS: Players simultaneously improve their skills and score points for combos.
3. MOVES: Players take turns navigating the park, picking up goals and gear.
4. ROUND END: Each player resets their board and draws up to their hand size, then the "Pro Skater" first player marker passes to the left.

If any player's score has hit or passed the endgame token at the end of the round, the game ends and players count up their endgame points. The player with the highest score wins!

A quick, quirky, and strategic card game good for 2-6 players. The basic goal of the game is to get the most points (or "Francs") in your bank by the time any player gets five cards in their bank. Most cards have point values on them, from 2-10 and then 13. Each turn, a player either puts a franc in their bank, takes a card from the draw pile, or takes a card from another player's hand. There are also special cards called Sanks, Yanks, and Thanks, which either take Francs from someone else's bank, or protects Francs in your own bank.

This super fun card game tests how well you know your partner, with a twist!

If you like getting competitive and could use a fun way to sneak in a little workout together, this is the perfect game for you!

There are 2 deck of card with a mixture of 'Two Truths and a Lie' cards and 'Would You Rather' cards. Guess what your partner will say and if you're wrong, you have to do the penalty on the card!

Laugh, have fun, and learn something new about one another!

—description from from the publisher

Ordered Witch is a fast board game for families for children that are around 4 years old.

We are little witches who need to sort the magic items that have escaped from their cupboards.

Will you be the first witch to climb to the top of the tower?

On our turn we can play a family (by item or by color) or we can play a wand to other player (wands have negative effects).

When we complete a family we gain 1 point and when we have no cards in hands we gain as points as families are in the table.

The objective is to climb to the top of the tower (15 points).

-description from publisher

A historical trivia game that sees you moving through different time periods and answering questions about that time. For every answer you get wrong, you build part of your own execution device. Get 9 incorrect answers and you are out of the game.

Jungleball is a small box dexterity game where you can draft a team of all-stars discovering powerful synergies between the large roster of unique players! You can assemble your players around an arena that changes with every game, toss dodgeballs at your opponents, move around the field, activate abilities, AND land critical hits until only one team remains!

Do you have what it takes to be a Jungleball champion?

Jungleball is a dexterity game that plays in about 15 minutes. The game is played through a sequence of turns where players will throw small wooden disks at their opponent's characters hoping to land on them and get them out. Every character has a number indicating the amount of dodgeballs that can land on them before they must go out. Activating a character allows the player to move that character anywhere on the board, use that character's unique ability, and then throw dodgeballs (wooden disks) from wherever they move that character to. Play ends if all the characters on one team go out, the player with characters remaining is the victor!

-description from publisher

Shaktis: Mind the Plot is a 2-player strategic board game where nature, mysticism, and metaphysics intertwine in an enchanted forest of botanical secrets and contemplative insight. As players, you are seekers—cultivating your own garden plots by placing Seedstones with intention and guiding your choices through the wisdom of Yaksis, mysterious guardians of this verdant realm.

But this is no ordinary game. With each move, you’re not just growing a garden—you’re tending the landscape of your own mind. Drawing from a philosophical lexicon inspired by Terence McKenna and Alan Watts, Shaktis invites bold decisions, rich debate, and metaphoric meaning. Its signature Ripple Rule ensures that every action echoes—affecting the state of play in ripples of cause and consequence.

Beautifully illustrated and designed as a "canvas of curiosity," Shaktis is both playful and profound—a magical microcosm where the ordinary folds into the extraordinary, and strategy becomes a form of soulful exploration.

A Single Sheet Print and Play Eurogame. Simple to pick up play with plenty of strategy, depth and decision space.

Thorngate Tower has been taken over by all manner of unworldy creatures. Your task is to initially clear out the dungeon area. Whilst slaying foes from 4 different realms to gain the favour of Thorngates guild owners you must also try to rescue as much treasure as you can along the way in order to prove that you are worthy of entering the remainder of the Tower.

Thorngate Dungeon is played over a series of 16 Rounds where in each you will be taking actions based on the rolls of 4 dice. Everything is contained on a single sheet of A4 paper and all that is needed from you is a pencil per player and 4 dice for the whole group.

—description from the designer

It’s Cow Pie Catapults – the poo flippin’, cow tippin’ battle of the barnyard! Arrange your cows on your side of the barnyard, load up the catapults, and let the fun begin! On 3-2-1 poo is launched through the air and lands with splendid splats. First player to knock over all the opponent’s cows is the winner!

-description from publisher's website

A demo case for the QUIZscape series, published by moses Verlag. This demo contains a very small time travel story that demonstrates the mechanisms of the QUIZscape games. The players have to travel through time to rescue a missing team.

Each card contains a riddle that has to be solved to continue in the story.

Hello Kitty and her friends have a nice day ahead and must decide what to do. But every one has his preferences (randomly distributed in the beginning of the game). Where they go?

There are 16 different activities and the player use a dice to manipulate the position of every activity in a "Preference Scale".

Each time an activity reach the spot 8 in the preference scale, the players stop the game to make a decision: Are we according to go to this activity? In order to do so, every player has a hand of five cards (4 "No" cards and 1 "Yes" card). If any player use a No Card, the activity is discarded. Yes Cards return to the players, but "No" cards are also discarded, so the players will have less opportunities to use "No" cards during the game.

If an activity receives only yes cards, the game ends and the players receive victory points according the position of his/her preference activity in the preference scale. Discarded activities bring no victory points.

What’s the Story? invites children to retell and create stories with playful animal characters and adventures. There are endless ways to use these cards. The publishers include many suggestions and you can develop your own.

The game includes many rule variants, with differing win conditions including some requiring a certain number of cards to win.


        description from publisher **

HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES? This game requires good skills and a strategy in order to win.. simply load the bull up with you accessories, wind it up and watch as he goes crazy trying to get the stuff off his back! Tipping up, down and around the bull will make sure he's victorious.. unless you think you can beat him!

The player that collects the most items is the winner of the game.

Circles features a double-sided game board, with both games being driven by the same game-action mechanism — a player rolling a ball in the felt-covered exterior ring of the track. Place the ball in the right spaces, and you'll make good progress!

On one side of the game board, you dive into the Wild West to mine gold and silver, fight bandits, and fulfill your dream of owning your own ranch. On the other side, you visit the shooting range and try your hand at hitting various targets.

Madori-ism is a card game in which cards are stacked and connected to create a floor plan. Place a lot of features you want and erase unnecessary features to aim for the ideal floor plan.

There are two rules included “Design Together” (for 2 to 5 people), where everyone collaborates to make one floor plan, and "Design Apart" (for 1 to 5 people), where each person makes their own floor plan. At the start of the game in both rules, you are given an entryway card that shows you a main objective and a side objective (only used in “Design Apart”) which are your main scoring criteria. These objectives are hidden from the rest of the players.

Design Together: One entryway is placed in the center and you take turns choosing from 3 floor plan cards to add on to the group floor plan. Your goal is to have as many of your main objective fixtures as possible.

Design Apart: Each player creates their own personal floor plan by taking turns choosing a card, with main objective fixtures being worth 1 VP. The side objectives, windows, and variety of fixtures are used to round out the scoring.

CRYPTOSPACEGAME lets you control an intrepid team of crypto currency miners who want to reach the world of their dreams within a year of in-game time. Can you make those dreams come true? Follow the crypto currency exchange rates, devise a clever strategy for money transfer, and multiply your riches. Win the top spot in the race to a life of luxury!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a peaceful game, and you will not have to attack your partners. However, you will have to obtain more crypto currency than others and get the most expensive dreams before anyone else does. Think hard, and with a little luck, you may win!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a game about the world of cryptocurrency, but you need no background knowledge or preparation to play it.

—description from the designer

North America, the 1920s. There is an old mansion surrounded by disturbing rumours: “The owner, a wealthy man, was devoted to ancient and blasphemous cult.”, “A decade ago, the inhabitants suddenly vanished.”, “All who entered the mansion disappeared, and the few who returned took their own lives soon after.”… The many strange phenomena that occur here hold a dark fascination attracting experts in mysticism and magic. Then, one day, the mansion is visited by a new group of people: A team of investigators from Miskatonic University. How they will end up only depends on the mysterious girl who will hold their fate in her hands…

Madness Hour is an asymmetrical cooperative game of exploration, based on the Cthulhu Mythos by the works of H. P. Lovecraft. One of the players takes the role of the mysterious girl, while the others play investigators, searching for ancient artefacts and trying to escape from a dangerous mansion. You won’t know whether the girl you will encounter in the mansion is human or something more terrifying. The girl’s intentions will depend on her identity, and she will manipulate and change the course of the investigators and the objects they hold. As they investigate, they will have to try and figure out what she is and what she is not.

The mysterious relics that the investigators find in the mansion will drive them into madness and turn them into something else. The investigation within the dark mansion is a mixture of madness and suspicion, leading to unexpected consequences. Will you be able to unravel the true identity of the mysterious girl who controls your destiny and escape from the mansion – while still being human…?

You have been recruited by Arsène Lupin to participate with your friends in three major burglaries: find the treasure of the abbeys, take possession of the fortune of the kings of France and steal the blue diamond from the crown! But beware! Because, among the burglars, a surprise guest has managed to infiltrate: Sherlock Holmes, master of disguise, has integrated the band around the nose and beard of the great Arsène Lupin.

In addition to solving the enigmas which stand on the path of your burglaries, you will also have to identify Holmes, and his friend Watson, before he sabotages your plan. Will you manage to thwart the artifices and pierce the disguises of each other to identify who, among you, embodies Sherlock Holmes, or Watson or even the champion of dissimulation, the great Arsène Lupin in person?

Read the murder mystery, collect the clues, use decoder with cards to determine the crime, and if Arsene got away with it or Sherlock caught him.
Player or team wins when crime is revealed. If neither team guesses correctly play continues until all is revealed and one team claims victory.

—user summary

Roll and move Buddy the Elf from the North Pole to Manhattan.  Make sure to spread Christmas cheer and don’t eat the yellow snow!

This game has 2-4 players play as Buddy the elf racing to find their dad in Manhattan.  Straight roll and move game with events on the board that may move you forward or backwards (many backwards are -20 spaces).  First player to the North Pole wins.

—user summary

ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒžãƒ«ã‚³ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚° (Animal Collecting) is a card game from Japan. The deck allows two games to be played: Hide & Seek, and Rebellion.

The players are zoo keepers and must sort the zoo out. For the game Hide & Seek, they swap cards in the style of Old Maid and try to complete sets of animals. Or they can guess the missing animal, a card drawn face-down to the table at the start of the game. However, there is also a black cat card, which a player may pass as an alternate to the requested card.

In the game Rebellion, one player is unhappy with the zoo's policies and is disrupting the zoo by hidden different animals in different places. In a one vs many game, the other three players must deduce where the animals are hidden.
user summary

Legends of Hellas is a co-operative game in which players act as heroes trying to defeat mythological monsters. Unlike many other cooperative games, players cannot see each other’s cards. On top, they are not allowed to communicate with each other to provide hints about the cards they hold. Over the course of 1 to 12 missions, between 1 and 5 players will fight a series of terrifying monsters. Each mission requires the player(s) to defeat 7 monsters without running out of cards; their fate is in your hands!

On their turn, a player must select and perform one of the following 5 actions:


    Fight - Play one of your action cards face-up next to the monster card on which your hero disc is located.
    Move - Whenever you move your hero disc from one monster card to another, you must discard 1 action card from your hand.
    Recover - Draw action cards from the draw pile, so that you hold up to 5 action cards in your hand. No matter how many cards you draw, you must then discard a card from your hand, face-down.
    Support - Give one or more cards from your hand to a fellow player. The receiving player must then discard at least 1 card from their hand to the discard pile, face-down.
    Consult the Oracle - Draw the top 6 action cards from the deck and place them face-up on the table. Choose and discard one of those cards. Then return the remaining 5 cards to the top of the deck in any order of your choosing.


A mission is won when the last Chimera is defeated. However, if a player ever holds no action cards in their hand AND has to draw from the depleted draw pile, the mission is lost. On the other hand, if the draw pile is depleted but the players can still take turns with the cards in their hands, the mission may still be won.

-description from publisher

Choose wisely the celebrity whose name you will make guess among your cards according to the challenge imposed. Attention! You only have 45 seconds to succeed! Meet the biggest stars of the world and of our country. Actors, comedians, politicians, athletes and even mystery personalities... Mime, draw, question and imitate! Laughter and fun are guaranteed.

ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒžãƒªãƒ¼ãƒŠ (Animarina) is a tile placement game from Japan.

Players are explorers in a wild land in Africa, looking for a lost family member. They encounter various animals who offer to help, in return for being the most favoured animal in the land.

Players draw cards in their and place them across spaces on the game board, linking up with arrows on the card edges. The player's goal is to create the largest area in their own colour. By using the animals special abilities, they can gain and secure more land.

Some animals are stronger in certain habitats, such as the gorilla in the forest. Some animals gain strength from being linked in a herd.

A player can place their animal over another if their animal has a higher number. So a #4 dog can cover a #3 dog, and extend the territory.

When the game ends, the player covering the most spaces is the winner.
user summary

Trekking the World Trivia is a family trivia game that lets players experience countries all around the world in a fun and interesting way. You don’t have to be good at trivia in order to play and love this game. Players will make their best guesses at the question to earn points. Anyone can play and win. Plus setup is easy—just open the box and start playing within minutes.

It doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a trivia game, games for teens, or family games, this one is perfect for your next family game night. The box is small (8x8), which makes it easy to take on the road or in the car.

You and your fellow bounty hunters are seeking out amazing treasures and rewards, but in your heart of hearts you are competing for the ultimate prize: to become the fastest gun in the world. Are you fast enough?

In this one of a kind strategic card collecting game, you gunslingers get the most points by winning and stacking multiples of each treasure and reward.

But gaining the cards takes some strategy and skill...

—description from the back of the box

Your organization has been infiltrated by moles, nefarious informants from the enemy. As faithful agents, you must work together to uncover and eliminate all the traitors.

Infiltraitors is a challenging deduction card game with twenty missions. Suspect cards are set aside at the start; these are the traitors who must be identified by suit and numbers. Players must manage their hands to give clues on the suspect cards. Clues may match with a traitor by having the same suit or where the number is either a multiple or a factor of the traitor's.

As the clues accumulate, players may deduce the identity of a traitor card, but can you catch them all before the time runs out?

Boj o Velku Moravu ("The Battle for Great Moravia") is an original Slovak strategy game that will take you back to a time when there was a relentless fight between the armies of the Eastern Franks, Western Slavs and old Hungarians in our region.

Each of the players will be one of the nations and strive to occupy as much territory as possible on the playing field with the help of their military party. By occupying settlements in battles, players gain points that they can use to develop their army and settle free territory. Each nation has its own characteristics, so on the road to victory, everyone must use a slightly different strategy. The winner is the player who has the largest territory at the end of the game, but the victory can be sided with the occupation of a strategic place or the size of the army.

Build an Aquarium together while trying to satisfy the demands of the fishes

Players work together to build a 5x5 Aquarium grid while trying to ensure that the mathematical equations hold true on all connecting sides of the tile
Each animal tile states a number along with the < or > symbol on each side
Players take turns placing a tile from their hand trying to successfully build the 25 tile aquarium

It’s time for a picnic! Rabbits and foxes work together to find as many fruit and vegetables as they can, as quickly as they can. So that they don’t get lost, they decide to tie themselves together with a string. Which team will gather the most carrots, watermelons, apples and pineapples?

Your meeples, a fox and a rabbit, are tied-together and you have to move them to take fruit optimizing their movement. Each turn, a wheel will be spun and you have to move according your meeples that are tied together so have limited movements.

When three pineapples have been taken, the player with most fruit will be the winner.

Each gardener will need a good memory and a strategy for flipping the pyramids in the right direction to find weather that is indicated on the current page of the books to help a flower to grow. First who has a complete beautiful flower will be the winner.

Nook and his friends enjoy fishing for crayfish under the Caribbean sun. Only Rainbo, the Lorikeet, disapproves of these frenzied fishing parties and will try to stop them.

Each player has cards representing a team of raccoon dogs with different strenghs, some lobsters  and a parrot. Every turn, you select one card, hidden face. By bluffing the others and a little bit of luck, the player will have to select the correct one, to catch the lobsters of the other players (only the biggest raccoon of the trick wins) without being disturb by a parrot.
